The Human Sciences Research Council (HSRC) Year 3 activities focus on gaps identified in the “Key Populations, Key Solutions” report compiled by the Desmond Tutu HIV Foundation. Four key priority areas have been defined, which include: 1. A rapid assessment of the acceptability of combination HIV prevention programmes for key populations (KPs) highlighting harm reduction strategies; 2. Costing f Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.12: Laboratory Infrastructure. Development and strengthening of laboratory systems and facilities to support HIV/AIDSrelated activities including purchase of equipment and commodities and provision of quality assurance, staff training and other technical assistance. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.2: Sexual Prevention - Abstinence/Be Faithful. Activities (including training) to promote abstinence, fidelity, reducing multiple and concurrent partners, and related social and community norms that impact these behaviors. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.5: Sexual Prevention - Other Sexual Prevention. Other activities (including training) aimed at preventing HIV transmission including purchase and promotion of condoms, STI management (if not in palliative care settings/context), messages/programs to reduce other risks of persons engaged in high-risk behaviors. objectives
